data.title: Motor City Groove: A Stevie Wonder Tribute
data.text:
MAY

TUE

14

May 14, 2024 | Doors 7:00 pm ← PAST EVENT

Motor City Groove: A Stevie Wonder Tribute

Tickets: $17

Age 18+

Enjoy a Stevie Wonder tribute night at S.O.B.’s featuring a live ensemble band playing all of his hits, directed by Marlon Saunders. This evening marks the firs collaboration with SOBs and The New School of Jazz and Contemporary Music

The music of Motown, or the Motown sound, is a style of R&B, soul and mainstream pop appeal of the 1960s and early 1970s. The sound grew out of Detroit, Michigan where teams of songwriters and musicians produced material for girl groups, boy bands and solo singers. The Motown sound changed the vision, the texture and the style of American music. The New School of Jazz and Contemporary Music’s Motor City Groove Ensemble explores and creates the style and sound of Motown. Led by faculty member, Marlon Saunders, The Motor City Groove Ensemble’s performance will be a tribute to the genius and music of Stevie Wonder.
